description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Otaru" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Otaru

places.generalDescription: Moiwa Ropeway get in point is the starting point for an unforgettable journey up Mount Moiwa, a 531-meter-high mountain located in central Sapporo. Visitors can take a Swiss-made mini cable car to reach the peak and enjoy a 360-degree panoramic view of Ishikari Plain, Ishikari Bay, and Mashike Mt.Shokanbetu without any obstructions.

sources.siteName: Hokkaido Official Tourism Site HOKKAIDO LOVE!
sources.shortName: Perfect for a date! Romantic night view spot!ÔΩúFeaturesÔΩúHOKKAIDO LOVE! -Hokkaido Official Tourism Site

places.name: Mount Moiwa Ropeway Entrance

reviews.text:
If you're in Sapporo and wondering where to catch the best sunset-or just want to see the whole city laid out like a glowing circuit board-the Mt. Moiwa Ropeway is where it's at.

The ride up is smooth, scenic, and quick. First, you hop on a ropeway that glides over lush green hills, and then transfer to a cute little mini cable car that brings you right to the summit. At the top? A 360¬∞ panoramic view of Sapporo, the mountains, and on clear days, even the sea. It's a whole vibe-especially as the sun starts to dip and the lights of the city flicker on.

There's a caf√© and a small observation deck (which can get crowded at golden hour), but honestly, the view does all the heavy lifting. There's even a ‚Äúlovers' bell‚Äù and lock wall if you're feeling romantic-or just want an excuse to ring a bell and make a wish.

üí° Pro tip: Time it right-arrive about 45‚Äì60 minutes before sunset to beat the crowds and snag the best spot. And bring a jacket. Even in summer, that mountain breeze means business.

Visit during summer or fall or spring. Not winter. The view depends on the weather. There are also a lot of people. So there are lines everywhere. There is just a viewing balcony at the top and then a little bit of playground for people to lounge in and a cafe for those who want to snack.

Great place, great view. The restaurant is expensive but it is an experience worth it. If thats to expensive there is a little coffe store. Also you should make a reservation in advance for the restaurant. If you plan to hike the mountain definitely bring a bear bell as there are many bears in Hokkaido.  (Currently the night view is only possible when hiking down as the rope way as a mechanical failure Informationen as of 11/08/2025 d/m/y).

places.address: 5 Chome-3-7 Fushimi, Chuo Ward, Sapporo, Hokkaido 064-0942, Japan

places.generalDescription: The Otaru Canal is a must-see landmark in Otaru, Hokkaido, offering a glimpse into the city's rich history and unique blend of Japanese and Western architecture. Built during Otaru's prominence as a major port city, the canal is lined with charming masonry warehouses that have been converted into specialty shops. Visitors can take leisurely strolls along the canal, imagining its bustling past when it was used for unloading merchandise from larger vessels to smaller ones.

sources.snippet: The Otaru Taisho Glass Museum is the main branch of the Otaru Glass Museum, which has 13 stores in Otaru City and other areas in Hokkaido. It is said that many excellent glass works were produced in Japan during the Taisho period (1912-1926). The Otaru Taisho Glass Museum exhibits and sells a wide variety of glassware, including Japanese-style glassware that inherits the style of the Taisho period, based on the concept of "conveying the beauty of the Taisho period to the modern age.ÔøΩÔøΩ...More
sources.shortName: First recommendation for Otaru.ÔøΩÔøΩThe 18 Best Things to Do in Otaru.

sources.snippet: The iconic Otaru Canal, lined with gas lamps and historic buildings, is one of the most picturesque locations in the city. In Winter, be sure to visit during the Otaru Snow Light Path Festival, where the soft glow of countless snow lanterns illuminate the canal, providing the perfect bokeh effect for those capturing it on camera. Tip: Include reflections of buildings in the water to capture a well-balanced photo, especially at sunrise and sunset.
sources.shortName: Top Photography Spots in Otaru, Japan

sources.snippet: When it comes to night view spots in the port town of Otaru, the Otaru Canal is a must-see. At dusk, the gas lamps along the promenade light up, and the stone warehouses are illuminated, creating a nostalgic atmosphere and a fantastical scene different from the daytime. In recent years, the "Otaru Canal Cruise," which has become a staple, has seen a rise in popularity for its night cruises that depart after sunset.
sources.siteName: Hokkaido Official Tourism Site HOKKAIDO LOVE!
sources.shortName: Perfect for a date! Romantic night view spot!ÔΩúFeaturesÔΩúHOKKAIDO LOVE! -Hokkaido Official Tourism Site

sources.snippet: Completed in 1923, the Otaru Canal was built for small boats called ‚Äúhashike‚Äù to carry cargo from main ships anchored in the harbor to warehouses. After the war, the canal ceased its role as a canal and part of it was reclaimed, but the north side (commonly called ‚ÄúNorth Canal‚Äù) remains 40m wide as it was in those days. When the canal is lit up at dusk or when snow falls in winter, it offers a very romantic scene.
sources.shortName: History and Tourist Information of Otaru, Hokkaido, with its beautiful cityscape

sources.snippet: The Otaru Canal, lined with historic stone warehouses, creates a romantic and nostalgic atmosphere. During the winter months, Otaru is blessed with heavy snowfall and the canal is beautifully illuminated, creating a stunning scene. The unique blend of history, picturesque landscapes, and its good accessibility from Sapporo make it a popular destination for both domestic and international travelers.
sources.siteName: Hokkaido Treasure | Hokkaido Treasure Island Travel Inc.
sources.shortName: Sip and Savor Otaru! | Hokkaido Treasure

sources.snippet: Otaru, which once prospered from herring fishing, was also the center of Hokkaido‚Äôs economy. Financial institutions were concentrated in Otaru, and at one time the city was so prosperous that it was called the ‚ÄúWall Street of the North. Even today, there are many historical buildings such as stone Western-style buildings and old Japanese architecture remaining here and there in the city.
sources.shortName: Hokkaido Otaru City Tourist InformationÔΩúEnjoy Slow Travel in Otaru, HokkaidoÔΩúUU-Hokkaido

sources.snippet: The Canal is one of Otaru‚Äôs most important places in the city. It is home to many restaurants and stores flanking its banks, and in the past, it was arguably the heart that kept the city going. The canal was used to ship things to and from the city and as such, there are a lot of old stone buildings in the area that were built around the turn of the century.
sources.shortName: Top 31 Things To Do In Otaru, Japan

sources.snippet: Once you arrive, step back in time with a stroll along the waterside in the town‚Äôs attractive canal district. Leave the station by the east exit, cross over the large road directly in front of the station, and head east down Chuo Dori street towards Otaru Canal. The canal is around 10 minutes walk from the station.
sources.shortName: A Day Out in Otaru | Blog

sources.snippet: The Former Shibusawa Warehouse, located on the north side of the Otaru Canal along the ‚ÄúNorth Canal,‚Äù was used by a warehouse company founded by Eiichi Shibusawa, whose name appears on Japanese paper money. It is now designated as a historic building by the city of Otaru, and is used as a live music venue and cafe.
sources.shortName: 6 Popular Movie and TV Drama Filming Locations in Otaru

sources.snippet: Around 15 minutes' walk from Otaru station, the Otaru Canal is the symbol of the town. It celebrated its 100th anniversary in 2023. Brick and stone warehouses line the canal, a reminder of Otaru's role as a trading hub for Hokkaido during the rapid industrialisation of Japan in the Meiji and Taisho periods.
sources.shortName: an Unforgettable Day Trip from Sapporo

sources.snippet: Otaru Canal is the main attraction in Otaru and was built in 1923. The canal is bordered by a walkway so that you can stroll along the banks of the waterway and if you can make sure to come here in the evening as this is when the promenade is illuminated with ancient oil lamps giving it an old world feel.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Otaru (Japan)

sources.snippet: Of course, no trip to Otaru would be complete without a visit to the beloved and picturesque Otaru Canal. It‚Äôs no wonder that many of the city‚Äôs events are held around the canal. It‚Äôs an absolutely charming sight to behold no matter the time of day or the season.
sources.shortName: An Otaru Day Trip From Sapporo - Otaru, Hokkaido

sources.snippet: A visit to Otaru is incomplete without experiencing the charming Otaru Canal. The canal is just a 12 to 15-minute walk from JR Otaru Station. It is accented with cobblestone pathways, vintage gas street lamps, brick warehouses, and gently flowing waterways.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Things to Do in Otaru: From Charming Canals to LeTAO, Seafood Delights, and Stunning Night Views

sources.snippet: The Otaru Canal, the most famous sightseeing spot in Otaru, runs through the central area of the city. The footpath along the canal is perfect for a stroll along the water. The warehouses, which used to be storehouses, stand by the canal.
sources.shortName: Otaru: Top 10 Day Trip Destinations in Sapporo's Charming Neighbor

sources.snippet: From Otaru Canal, you can walk to Sakaimachi Shopping Street. There are a lot of romantic architecture and souvenir shops on this street.
sources.shortName: „ÄêA must-go place in Hokkaido„ÄëRomantic view enjoy ÔºÜdiscover sweet street in Otaru.

places.name: Otaru Canal

reviews.text:
A very short (1.6 KM) canal that was built by landfill over the beach to be easier to move goods from inland to the cargo ships. Nowadays becomes the tourist attraction.

Highly recommend to purchase tickets before hand. The canal river tour will less about 40 minutes. Headset are provided with mamy languages by selecting the right channel.

It was a relaxing event and you can walk along the canal after work.

One of the main attractions of Otaru however I expected a bit more from this place. There is just  simple walk with busy streets on side with loud cars. Didn't find it very relaxing. You have to cross the street or pass the canal to stop in some climatic cafe or just chill out. I thought the canal will be more calm and relaxing place.

This canal is absolutely beautiful, especially in winter when it's covered in snow - it really captures the atmosphere of the season. Many people gather here to take photos, but with a bit of patience, you can still find the perfect moment with a clear view.

Honestly, if you haven't been here, it's like you haven't truly visited Otaru. It's a lovely spot for a stroll, some great photos, and simply soaking in the vibe.

places.generalDescription: The Otaru Steam Clock, a British-style bronze clock standing at 5.5 meters tall, is a popular tourist attraction in the charming fishing village of Otaru, Japan. A gift from Vancouver, Canada, it is partially powered by a steam engine and chimes with a steam whistle every 15 minutes. Installed in 1994, it was once the world's second-largest steam clock. Visitors can capture picturesque photos of this iconic sight, especially on colder days.

sources.snippet: Needless to say, food is an essential part of any trip, especially in Japan. And in Otaru, the food experience can start right out the station at Sankaku Market, a local fish and seafood market. As it is a popular place, you should be aware that it gets very busy around lunchtime.
sources.shortName: an Unforgettable Day Trip from Sapporo

sources.snippet: * This is probably the most famous attraction* after the Otaru Canal. As you can guess from the name, this is a watch that works for a couple. They were made in the Canadian city of Vancouver by the Japanese-Canadian community and donated to the city of Otaru.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Otaru

sources.snippet: One of the signature attractions in Otaru is the Steam Clock which has pride of place in the city and is also one of its most iconic sights that you absolutely shouldn‚Äôt miss.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Otaru (Japan)
Otaru - Hokkaido Guide

places.name: Otaru Steam Clock

reviews.text: Very cool clock gifted from Canada! It goes off on every hour and 15 minutes before the hour. The bell tower across the street also plays on some hours, and starts a minute or two after the steam clock chime.

This place is located along a tourist belt where there are a lot of shops and restaurants.

This place sells a wide variety of musical boxes in different designs, ranging from around 1000 yens to 10,000 yens for the  souvenirs. This place has 3 levels and so it took a while to see and hear the difference musical. Each design comes with different music.

After much consideration, I bought a Lucky Cat musical box, which I thought was difficult to find in a normal retail shop.

The Otaru Steam Clock is a vintage-style that whistles and releases puffs of steam every 15 minutes, delighting visitors with its gentle chimes and old-world charm. People usually line up to take photos but since I visited mid-week and late in the afternoon, there aren't much tourists.

places.generalDescription: Otaru Canal Boat LLC offers day and dusk cruises along a restored canal lined with former warehouses, now housing museums and shops. The Otaru Taisho Glass Museum, part of the Otaru Glass Museum, showcases a wide variety of glassware from the Taisho period. The canal cruise provides unique views of Otaru's historic buildings while the captain shares commentary on the surrounding scenery.

sources.snippet: The Otaru Taisho Glass Museum is the main branch of the Otaru Glass Museum, which has 13 stores in Otaru City and other areas in Hokkaido. It is said that many excellent glass works were produced in Japan during the Taisho period (1912-1926). The Otaru Taisho Glass Museum exhibits and sells a wide variety of glassware, including Japanese-style glassware that inherits the style of the Taisho period, based on the concept of "conveying the beauty of the Taisho period to the modern age.ÔøΩÔøΩ...More
sources.shortName: First recommendation for Otaru.ÔøΩÔøΩThe 18 Best Things to Do in Otaru.

sources.snippet: Otaru, which once prospered from herring fishing, was also the center of Hokkaido‚Äôs economy. Financial institutions were concentrated in Otaru, and at one time the city was so prosperous that it was called the ‚ÄúWall Street of the North. Even today, there are many historical buildings such as stone Western-style buildings and old Japanese architecture remaining here and there in the city.
sources.shortName: Hokkaido Otaru City Tourist InformationÔΩúEnjoy Slow Travel in Otaru, HokkaidoÔΩúUU-Hokkaido

sources.snippet: Experience the enchanting beauty of Otaru's historic buildings along the iconic Otaru Canal, a captivating scene that resembles a masterpiece from any angle. To fully immerse yourself in the charm of Otaru's architectural history, consider taking the Otaru Canal Cruise. While the captain comments on the surrounding scenery, you can appreciate unique views only accessible from the water.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Things to Do in Otaru: From Charming Canals to LeTAO, Seafood Delights, and Stunning Night Views

sources.snippet: While you‚Äôre in the area admiring the water, why not gain a new perspective of Otaru from the water‚Äôs surface?. Take a cruise along the canal and create memories (and photos) that will last a lifetime. There are seven cruises during the daytime and five during the dark.
sources.shortName: An Otaru Day Trip From Sapporo - Otaru, Hokkaido

sources.snippet: In recent years, the "Otaru Canal Cruise," which has become a staple, has seen a rise in popularity for its night cruises that depart after sunset. The gas lamps and building lights reflect on the canal's surface, offering a romantic experience.
sources.siteName: Hokkaido Official Tourism Site HOKKAIDO LOVE!
sources.shortName: Perfect for a date! Romantic night view spot!ÔΩúFeaturesÔΩúHOKKAIDO LOVE! -Hokkaido Official Tourism Site

places.name: Otaru Canal Boat LLC

reviews.text: I was worried whether the weather was going to be nice or not. I took the 11:00 boat and the weather was fortunately super amazing. I could enjoy the  marvelous landscape around the otaru canal. But I wouldn't recommend taking the boat when the visibility is bad.

Visited during the low season in winter, hoping for a peaceful, scenic experience. The historical canal had its charm, and the gondola riders seemed to be enjoying themselves-but personally, I found it a bit underwhelming. Maybe I was missing the romance, or maybe I just needed a steaming cup of hot cocoa to liven things up.

We had an absolute blast during our visit! The staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating, making the experience even more enjoyable. We used headsets for English translation during the tour, which worked perfectly. Although the tour was short, it was definitely worth it!

I do think it would have been even more enjoyable if we had gone in the late afternoon or just after sunset, as we faced some bright sun rays at certain angles. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and informative outing!

places.generalDescription: SUSHIBAR is a modern restaurant and bar located near Otaruchikko Station, offering a stunning view of Ishikari Bay and Otaru Port Marina. The specialized chefs prepare a delightful array of sushi, amuse-bouche, and Italian dishes. The warm and homely atmosphere adds to the dining experience, with courteous staff providing excellent service. Guests can enjoy fresh and perfectly crafted sushi and sashimi, with just the right amount of wasabi.

sources.snippet: Located near Otaruchikko Station, this restaurant is a nice place for dinner. It is a modern bar and restaurant overlooking Ishikari Bay and Otaru Port Marina. You can savor sushi, amuse-bouche, and Italian dishes prepared by specialized chefs while enjoying the beautiful nightscape.
sources.shortName: Recommended Lunch and Dinner Spots for a Perfect Date in Otaru Discover Oishii Japan

places.name: SUSHIBAR

reviews.text: Aussie couple looking for great sushi & scored!! Didn't book, just got lucky as a walk in before they closed. Raw fish, rolls & sake were up there with the best we have had. The fattiest tuna is a must! Thanks so much, oishikatta!

Like the interior decor. There is socket provided for phone charging. The sushi platter is delicious. It was early June and not crowded during dinner. There is a piece of paper which can be folded into a chopsticks rest and it is called Fujiyama Paper rest. Adorable.

We had some delicious drinks and a few pieces of tasty sushi while we waited for the train nearby. They had a few different options for sake, shochu, beer, and others. The fish tasted incredibly fresh. Glad we stopped in!

places.generalDescription: Located in Otaru, Hokkaido, the LeTAO Main Store is a must-visit for food enthusiasts. The store is part of a chain that includes six outlets in Otaru, with five along Sakaimachi street. The main store features a cafe on the second floor where you can savor their signature Double Fromage Cheesecake and other delectable treats.

sources.snippet: Nestled in the enchanting Fairy Tale Crossroads of Sakaimachi Shopping Street stands the prominent tower-like structure of Otaru's well-known dessert and souvenir haven, the LeTAO Main Store. The ground floor offers an array of signature items such as the iconic double-layered cheesecake, cheese-filled cookies, and black tea chocolate cookies. Visitors can also explore exclusive items unique to this flagship store, and international tourists can take advantage of duty-free privileges.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Things to Do in Otaru: From Charming Canals to LeTAO, Seafood Delights, and Stunning Night Views

sources.snippet: Desserts are also a must-try when in Otaru, including the world-famous LeTAO cheesecakes that originated in this very city. Numerous branches are spread out all over the city where you can try cheesecakes, chocolates, soft serve ice creams and more. Speaking of ice cream, the 8-layer rainbow ice cream is also a must-try in Otaru.
sources.shortName: Trips from Niseko: A Day in Otaru

sources.snippet: Try their Double Fromage‚Äîcalled the masterpiece of LeTAO‚Äîthat has a rich, milky taste of smooth no-bake mascarpone cheesecake on top of a melt-in-your-mouth baked cheesecake. For chocolate lovers who need a bit more cacao in their cheesecake, the Chocolat Double will be your slice of heaven.
sources.shortName: An Otaru Day Trip From Sapporo - Otaru, Hokkaido

sources.snippet: Because Otaru is the birthplace of LeTao, some original sweets can be only found here. I tried their cheesecake and cheese biscuits, they all tasted good!!. Especially the cheesecake was so creamy and delicious!.
sources.shortName: „ÄêA must-go place in Hokkaido„ÄëRomantic view enjoy ÔºÜdiscover sweet street in Otaru.

sources.snippet: Follow your nose‚Äîand the trail of free samples‚Äîto LeTAO, Otaru‚Äôs most renowned local confectionery. The cheesecakes are made with Hokkaido‚Äôs finest dairy products, and they taste just like happiness.
sources.shortName: Otaru - GaijinPot Travel
First recommendation for Otaru.ÔøΩÔøΩThe 18 Best Things to Do in Otaru.

places.name: LeTAO Main Store

reviews.text:
The 1st floor is a store.

On the 2nd floor, at a cafe,
I ordered the  Special Chocolate  Cake set which came with tea.  It was delicious with the feel of  the main store advantage.

After the cakes, I checked out the 3rd floor observation deck.  It's only 3rd story high(it's a tower so actually higher than 3rd floor but the store says its on the 3rd so) but since other buildings are not tall, the place has a good vantage point. Don't forget to ring the bell. You will know what I mean.

Cafe is upstairs & could be accessed either by stairs or lift.

Don't be deceived by a short or long queue. We were there during golden week & we were listed as 37th in line and were waiting for 30 minutes. Believe me people usually give up on queueing so number will go pretty fast.

Just go upstairs & take the paper token for a queue. Screens on both floors will display the number of queue. QR code is available to add and check the queue status.

‚Ä¢ Set for one or two available.
‚Ä¢ Rule of thumb: 1 cake & 1 drink for each person.

We ordered a set of 3 cakes & 2 drinks. If you arrive in afternoon, just check if all the cakes are available. We wanted to order honey lemon tart but it was sold out. Next table ordered strawberry Mont Blanc but sorry we just took the last one.

‚Ä¢ Double fromage - Original one. Tried frozen one from airport before. Of course, fresh from the place is way better.
‚Ä¢ Strawberry Mont Blanc - Seasonal offer. I found strawberry flavors pretty weak. Chestnut wins.
‚Ä¢ Chocolate double fromage - just okay for me.
‚Ä¢ Iced tea & hot coffee - nothing outstanding.

‚Ä¢ Price - Set menu is pretty awesome & reasonable.
‚Ä¢ Worth waiting? - If you just sit & wait for longer than 30 minutes, no - not worth it. If you can stroll along the area to explore then come back in time for your queue like we did, then it's worth it.

LeTAO's main store in Otaru is a must-visit for anyone exploring the canal area. Their cafe above the store offers a delightful selection of beautifully plated desserts that are both visually appealing and tasty.

I ordered both of their shop-limited sets. I think their signature Double Fromage Cheesecake lived up to the hype in terms of its light and airy texture. The level of sweetness was just about right. The baked cheesecake had a more traditional, dense body, with a slightly caramelized top that added some depth. The chocolate cake was rich and overall satisfying, although I found the cream layers a bit too heavy for my taste.

While everything was delicious, it didn't quite exceed my expectations (hence the 4/5 stars). Not to say the food was bad, but it just felt a bit ‚Äúordinary‚Äù and was just lacking something (that would make the difference between good and excellent!).

If you're short on time, you can also grab takeaway items from the ground floor. But to fully appreciate the presentation and experience, I recommend actually taking the time to queue up and take a seat.

places.generalDescription: The Otaru Museum, consisting of the Main Building and the Canal Building, offers historical information and rail exhibits, featuring a model and several full-sized trains. Situated near Asarigawa Onsen, it is conveniently accessible from Otaru and Sapporo stations. The museum provides easy-to-understand exhibits suitable for both children and adults.

sources.snippet: Otaru used to be lined with many warehouses to store the goods brought in from the port. Among them, the Old Otaru Warehouse is a huge U-shaped warehouse surrounded by walls like a fortress and with a large courtyard inside for handling goods, and it still remains in the same form as it was back then. Part of the building is used as a museum, where you can see exhibits that give you a feel for the world of Golden Kamuy, such as what Otaru used to look like and Ainu traditional costumes that resemble Asirpa‚Äôs outfit.
sources.shortName: 6 Popular Movie and TV Drama Filming Locations in Otaru

sources.snippet: When it comes to accommodation in Otaru, there‚Äôs something for every budget. For a comfortable stay with fantastic amenities, I recommend Dormy Inn Premium Otaru Natural Hot Spring, a popular hotel chain known for its relaxing hot spring baths and great value. You could also consider Otaru Furukawa Hotel for a more luxurious experience, or Garden House Umenoya Otaru for a more budget-friendly option.
sources.shortName: an Unforgettable Day Trip from Sapporo

sources.snippet: Once night has fallen, set off to appreciate the Michelin-starred night view from the summit of nearby Otaru‚Äôs major mountain. Part of this hilly city is located on the lower slopes of Mt. Tengu, whose summit is accessible via the Otaru Tenguyama Ropeway. Opened in 1979, the line climbs Mt. Tengu to offer world-class panoramic views of the city from the top.
sources.shortName: A Day Out in Otaru | Blog

sources.snippet: Otaru, a city in Japan, has a long history of railways dating back to 1882. It proudly holds the title of the "Birthplace of Hokkaido Railway." The city is located about 15 minutes from Otaru Canal. The Otaru City Museum Main Building is a great destination for families seeking an enjoyable educational experience.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Things to Do in Otaru: From Charming Canals to LeTAO, Seafood Delights, and Stunning Night Views

sources.snippet: The museum is located in a warehouse which would have been built in 1893 and sits close to the famous Otaru Canal and you can find out how the city would have got its start as a result of its prolific herring trade which would have blossomed in the 20th century.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Otaru (Japan)

sources.snippet: The Otaru Railway Museum is located right outside of the Otaru City Museum. The railway is located quite conveniently on the former site of the terminal of Hokkaido‚Äôs first railway station. The railway once connected the city of Otaru with the city of Sapporo.
sources.shortName: Top 31 Things To Do In Otaru, Japan

sources.snippet: Those interested in the area‚Äôs history should visit the Otaru Museum or the Herring Mansion, a former wealthy fisherman‚Äôs residence that doubled as workspace and home. The Venetian Museum of Art both exhibits and sells beautiful glassworks.
sources.shortName: Otaru - GaijinPot Travel

places.name: Otaru City Museum

reviews.text:
If you are looking for something to do in the afternoon in Otaru that doesn't have too many tourists, I recommend here.

It isn't so busy, but the train trip is packed. It is only a short ride though.

There are so many interesting things to see here and learn about trains and their history  in Hokkaido. The kids loved it. We have been here three times already X-D

The Otaru City Museum is a must-visit for train lovers and history enthusiasts alike. The Main Building at Temiya is packed with full-size locomotives, including the famous steam engine ‚ÄúIron Horse,‚Äù as well as interactive train exhibits that are fun for both kids and adults. The Canal Building, near Otaru Canal, showcases the city's history and natural environment, providing a nice complement to the train-focused exhibits.

Admission is very affordable, and English pamphlets are available. Plan to spend at least 1‚Äì2 hours exploring both buildings.

Sheldon Cooper will approve of this place.  Everything about train, the types of engines, history of japan railway system and real life train models.  If you are going to the museum, do plan ahead to take the coal-powered engine train ride (limited timings), you can't find such an experience around anymore.  There are rows of trains outside the museum which showcases many old trains and you can actually walk inside the cabins.  Nothing particularly interesting but kind of cool seeing the trains of the past.

places.generalDescription: The Otaru Wine Gallery in Hokkaido, Japan offers award-winning sweet wines for sampling. Visitors can enjoy guided tours and gain insights into the local Japanese and Hokkaido wine industry. Despite misconceptions about Japan's wine production, Otaru is known for producing some of the best Japanese wines. The gallery provides premium wine tours that include a glimpse of the winemaking process and a tasting experience in a serene setting with picturesque views.

sources.snippet: Editor's Note: There's no photo available at the time of writing. Now you might not consider Japan to have a very vast wine-producing region but you‚Äôd be wrong. Some of the best Japanese wine comes from Otaru and the Hokkaido region.
sources.shortName: Top 31 Things To Do In Otaru, Japan

places.name: Otaru Wine Gallery

reviews.text: Came here for a premium wine tour, not sure what the difference is between regular tour and premium tour which is 5,000 yen. To get here from Otaru station by taxi is about 2,500-3000 yen so bottom line it is 8,000 yen per person.  The tour includes showing the tanks and equipments used to make the wine and a video of how wide the vineyard is.  It took an hour and then followed at the tasting room that is dark and quiet, no no sounds at all.  We were given small amounts of wine, maybe about 10 ml per tasting, 6 kinds and no additional.  The pairing food was just cheese with very small amount.  This does even meet the value of spending 8,000 yen to visit.  In tokyo if you pay this much, you get a whole plate of high quality cheese that you can even take home.  This winery needs to study on pairing as well as how to satisfy customers that are visiting from far away.  The winery needs to realize that customers are spending a lot of monies to visit and should at least try to make the spending and visit worthy of the money spent.  The tour guide was nice and tried his best but you are far far away from winery tours that are held in mainland Japan. You need a lot more improvement.  As of this time , i would not recommend this tour for others.

Amazing. This is a must visit when visiting the area. Myself and my wife had a great time. Enjoyed 6 wines over looking the sea. Good value. We were late for a tour but they still managed to allow us to join and watch the AMAZING video of the vineyard. Everyone was so friendly and I HIGHLY recommend visiting.

Hokkaido Otaru wine gallery
No free tasting
Place to buy wine.

places.generalDescription: Otaru Masazushi Main is a renowned sushi restaurant that has been serving customers for over 80 years, contributing to Otaru's reputation as a sushi town. The restaurant features a long counter on the first floor where up to 30 people can watch the skilled chefs prepare sushi while engaging in friendly conversations. Additionally, private rooms and halls are available on the upper floors.

sources.snippet: This restaurant is a nice place for dinner, and is located near Otaru Canal. The best seating at this famous sushi restaurant is by the counter. Located on Otaru Sushiya Street (Otaru Sushiya-dori), a street lined with long-established sushi restaurants, this outstanding restaurant is the perfect last stop on a date in Otaru.
sources.shortName: Recommended Lunch and Dinner Spots for a Perfect Date in Otaru Discover Oishii Japan

places.name: Otaru Masazushi Main (Hokkaido)

reviews.text: Signature dish Squid noodle has extraordinary taste and the ingredients are perfectly balanced. Had premium omakase course here but the portion is a little bit smaller than expected. Food are fresh and of high quality overall

My friend recommended this Japanese restaurant after a positive previous visit, but it seems the quality has declined slightly since then. Compared to other Japanese restaurants I've tried in various cities, the food here is just average. The service was somewhat slow, though the staff remained friendly and attentive.
One thing to note - their reservation system requires your entire party to be present before you can be added to the queue, which can be inconvenient if you're hungry. If you're really hungry and need a place to eat, it's acceptable, but don't expect exceptional Japanese cuisine. The good service somewhat makes up for the average food quality, but overall it's not as impressive as it apparently once was.

We went to the store at 10.45 a.m. on Friday and there was no queue, yet, so we got a chance to dine in a private room on the second floor. The atmosphere there was awesome. Their sushi tasted AMAZING from fresh ingredients and great taste of the rice. Definitely worth coming.

Reservation online is available, but you have to order and pay beforehand. So I recommend visit the restaurant a bit early and wait patiently in queue.

places.generalDescription: The Rokkatei Otaru Canal Store is a renowned Japanese-style confectionery shop known for its high-quality ingredients sourced from Hokkaido. Located just an 8-minute walk from Minami-Otaru Station, this store offers a wide range of Rokkatei products, including the much-loved 'Marseille Butter Sand' and the famous 'Marseille butter cake.'

sources.snippet: For true chocolate lovers, the NOUVELLE VAGUE LeTAO Chocolatier Otaru Main Store stands as a paradise of cocoa delights. This shop, located in the heart of Otaru, specializes in crafting exquisite chocolates that captivate the senses. The emphasis on quality ingredients and meticulous craftsmanship results in a range of chocolates that are as visually stunning as they are indulgent.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Things to Do in Otaru: From Charming Canals to LeTAO, Seafood Delights, and Stunning Night Views

sources.snippet: It is famous for it's rich cream taste, so I tried a bowl of soft ice cream. Milk ice cream meets the crunch of sweet biscuit, a combination like no other!!
sources.shortName: „ÄêA must-go place in Hokkaido„ÄëRomantic view enjoy ÔºÜdiscover sweet street in Otaru.

places.name: Rokkatei Otaru Canal Store

reviews.text:
The ground floor is their store. Including the candy, chips, chocolate, some are limited edition here (can't get it in the airport!)
First floor is their coffee shop with few seats to rest, they also sell Puff.

Papa Says: üëçüëçüëç+ I'll come to Otaru again to try this cookie fresh. Highly recommended if you're in Sapporo!

Chanced upon this pastry shop and was enticed by the "best consumed within 2 hours" sandwich cookie recommendation. I just HAD to try it, and I've got to say that this is hands down the best sandwich cookie I've had in Japan, even possibly my whole life. The cookie was thin, crunchy and the cocoa taste just cut through. As you bite into the cookie, the cheesecake is just the right amount of coldness, and melts as you sink your teeth into it.

Devoured the cookie in a minute and it's one of the best delicacies I've had on my Japan trip thus far.

Popular confectionary shop offering cream puffs, and cheesecake sandwiches. The first floor has treats to bring home, and the second floor has a cafe with excellent cost performance coffee at 120 yen.
